definition: lit. to steal a rafter and replace it with a column/to replace the original with a fake/to perpetrate a fraud (idiom)
to steal/to pilfer/to snatch/thief/stealthily
Liang Dynasty (502-557)/Later Liang Dynasty (907-923)/surname Liang
variant of 梁[liang2]
roof beam/beam (structure)/bridge
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
pillar/CL:根[gen1]

sentences.english: This company resorted to fraud to deceive the customers.
sentences.chinese: 这个公司偷梁换柱欺骗顾客。

sentences.english: The necklace placed in the palace is replaced first, and displaced later.
sentences.chinese: 放在宫殿里的项链先是被偷梁换柱，后来又被转移了。

definition: to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
to steal sb's valuable item and substitute a similar-looking but worthless item/to sell a fake for the genuine article/to palm off
see 掉包[diao4 bao1]
lit. the plum tree withers in place of the peach tree/to substitute one thing for another/to carry the can for sb
to pass off fish eyes for pearls/to pass off fake products as genuine (idiom)
to substitute on the sly
to defraud/to rig up (a scam)
to engage in fraudulent activities (idiom)/skulduggery/to hoodwink people/to cheat sb audaciously
to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory

lit. secretly crossing the Wei River 渭河[Wei4 He2] at Chencang (idiom, refers to a stratagem used by Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] in 206 BC against Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3] of Chu)/fig. to feign one thing while doing another/to cheat under cover of a diversion
to forge/fake/to fabricate (a story)
to get away with it/to slip through/to bluff one's way out/Taiwan pr. [meng1 hun4 guo4 guan1]
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to pass the misfortune on to sb else (idiom); to blame others/to pass the buck
to set a trap
lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
